snippet: On Monday, the city will begin an initiative designed primarily to help undocumented immigrants, the homeless and others navigate government bureaucracy and secure services.
abstract: New York City is unveiling country's largest municipal-identification program, issuing cards meant to be helpful to those who are undocumented, homeless and anyone who does not have government-issued identification; cards will give people access to city buildings, libraries and will be accepted at some banks and credit unions.
lead_paragraph: On Monday, the city will begin an initiative designed primarily to help undocumented immigrants, the homeless and others navigate government bureaucracy and secure services.

headline.main: New York City to Formally Start Its Municipal ID Card Program
headline.print_headline: With Rollout of IDs, Card-Carrying New Yorkers Can Step From the Shadows
